Flor has one school-aged son in her care, and currently she has been working as a janitor for a state company for more than four years. Her salary is earmarked for the household expenses.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy construction materials such as tile and paint, as she needs to carry out some improvements to her home. Only   through this loan would she be able to undertake this improvement, as using money from her salary is a little more difficult.

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as tile and paint.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Danisa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Danisa tiene 39 años de edad, es casada  y vive con sus 02 hijos y su esposo en su casa ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Danisa se dedica desde hace 03 años al negocio de venta de carteras, bolsos y paletas y actualmente ella elabora accesorios para damas, sus clientes son las estudiantes del colegio donde trabaja su esposo de lunes a viernes, los sábados y domingos  vende en su casa.
Doña Danisa está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cintas, peinetas, diademas lisas para forrar, chongos, botones y flores que son la materia prima para elaboración de los accesorios que sus clientes les piden.
La señora Danisa con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar un poco sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. 
Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y  tener más variedad de productos para la venta.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Danisa is 39 years old, married and lives with her husband and two children, in a home located in the San Lorenzo community in southern Honduras.

Danisa has been selling wallets, purses, and pallets for three years and currently makes ladies’ accessories.  Her customers are the students from the school where her husband works form Monday to Friday.  She sells from her home on the weekends.

Danisa is asking for a loan in order to buy ribbons, combs, tiaras, pony tails, buttons, and flowers.  These are the supplies she needs to make the accessories that her customers request.

With this loan, Danisa wants to improve her income and quality of life a bit.

Her dream is to have a large business and a greater variety of products for sale.

loans.use: para la compra de cintas, peinetas, diademas lisas para forrar, chongos, botones y flores para su negocio.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a 36-year-old, married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 2 to 15 years. She describes herself as a patient woman. 

Everline operates a pharmacy where she sells medicine. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition from within the area. 

Everline will use the 12,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is Everline's fifth loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, commercial maize, and sorghum seed.

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Marina Isabel, es dueña de  un negocio de  venta de refrescos naturales, gaseosas, agua helada frutas caramelos y galletas, sale de su casa a las 5:00 am se traslada a uno de los mercado a comprar su producto para la elaboración de refrescos y abre su negocio a las 6:30 am finalizando a la 5:00 pm, realiza este trabajo  desde hace veinte años para ayudar a sus esposo a mantener el hogar, ya que es madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres están estudiando.
 
La Señora  está solicitando un crédito el que utilizará  para  comprar manzanas, uvas, gaseosas, caramelos y galletas, para ofertarla a toda su clientela ya que  este tipo de  frutas tienen mayor demanda en la temporada navideña. 

Doña Marina  ha mejorado su nivel de vida y de su familia ya que con los ingresos obtenido producto de los créditos brindado por Ceprodel ha remodelado su humilde vivienda dándole más comodidad a su familia, sus sueños son    comprar una camioneta para trasladarse a su negocio.
texts.en:
Marina Isabel owns a business selling natural fruit drinks, soft drinks, cold water, fruit, candy and cookies. She leaves her house at 5am and goes to one of the markets to buy her produce for making drinks. She opens for business at 6:30am and finishes at 5:00pm. 

She has been doing this work for 20 years in order to help her husband support the household. She is the mother of four children, of whom three are in school. 

She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy apples, grapes, soft drinks, shaved ice, candy and cookies to sell them to all her customers. This type of fruit is in greater demand during the Christmas season.

Marina has improved her and her family's standard of living, as with the income obtained as a result of the loan provided by Ceprodel, she has renovated her modest home, providing more comfort for her family. Her dream is to buy a truck for her business.

loans.use: To buy apples, grapes, soft drinks, candy and cookies.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow coffee, maize, beans and bananas. They also keep chickens and pigs. 

Margaret looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Margaret will buy farming supplies. She dreams of being able to educate her children to the university level. She also would like to take adult education courses, herself.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale, so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 36 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo José y sus 2 hijos: Claudio y Mayela, a los que cuidan en la casa que compró, hace 8 años. Hace poco cerró su locutorio, donde brindaba el servicio de llamadas telefónicas. Por motivo de falta de capital de trabajo, tuvo que cerrar. Con el tiempo logró ahorrar una suma considerable de dinero gracias a su esposo, que trabaja en una empresa de autos como mecánico. Con ello compraron dos autos, que alquilan para el trasporte público; diario le pagan 30 nuevos soles por el servicio. Este negocio le ayuda mucho en los gastos del hogar, sobre todo porque no necesita mucho mantenimiento, pues su esposo mantiene en perfecta condición, cambiando el aceite y revisando constantemente el auto. “Gracias a su buen mantenimiento pueden trabajar sin problemas en el trasporte público”, comenta. Ahora espera juntar el dinero necesario para volver a abrir su primer negocio, donde está segura tendrá mucho éxito. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este el crédito número 27 con  MFP, en todo estos años, pudo mejorar su negocio, pues aprovechó el dinero con mucha inteligencia. Por otro lado promete una vez más cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, donde los integrantes son solidarios, “como una familia”, afirma.
Margarita; invertirá el dinero en la compra de baldes de aceite para el mantenimiento de los autos.
texts.en:
Margarita is 36, and hard-working woman. She lives with her husband José and their two children: Claudio and Mayela, whom they look after in the home that they bought eight years ago. 

A little while ago, she closed her call center, where she offered telephone call service. Because of a lack of working capital, she had to close. In time, she managed to save a considerable sum of money thanks to her husband who works as a mechanic at a car company. 

With this, they bought two vehicles which they rent out for taxi service. Each day they get 30 nuevos soles for this. This business helps her a great deal with household expenses, especially because not a lot of maintenance is needed, as her husband keeps the vehicles in perfect condition, changing the oil and constantly checking them. “Thanks to his good maintenance work, they can operate problem-free, providing public transportation," she says.

Now she hopes to save the necessary money to reopen her first business, where she is sure she will have a great deal of success. She belongs to the IDME communal bank, and this is her 27th loan with MFP. In all these years she has been able to improve her business, as has she used the money well and very wisely. 

Moreover, she again promises to make her installment payments. In addition, she is happy to be part of her group, because the members are supportive: "Like a family", she says.

Margarita will use the money to buy containers of oil for maintaining the vehicles.

loans.use: To buy containers of oil for maintaining the vehicle.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 53 años, se separó de su esposo hace 17 años, producto de su relación tuvo 4 hermosos hijos. Ahora vive solo con el mayor de sus hijos Paúl, en su casa propia ubicada en una ciudad de la selva central peruana. Ana con mucho coraje se dedica a la agricultura, donde siembra en las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que heredó de su madre; una variedad de cítricos, entre naranja, tanyarina y tanyelo, (cítricos) como también café. Los cuales comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced, en cada cosecha. Pues lo realiza con la ayuda de peones que contrata constantemente, ya que paralelo a este trabajo se dedica desde hace 12 años a trabajar como personal administrativo en un colegio del estado, donde percibe una remuneración mensual. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder estar ocupada, pues le agrada mucho ser independiente. 
“El trabajo es cansado y requiere de inversión, pero siempre veo la manera de abastecer a mis cultivos de las semillas, cuidados y fertilizantes”, menciona.
Ana desea que se la apoye, porque necesita adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café y frutos cítricos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Milagros”, y este es el préstamo número 10 que tiene con MFP, donde agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron en todo estos años.
Ana, comenzará con el mantenimiento de su cafetal en sus terrenos agrícolas; por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana is 53 years old.  She separated from her husband 17 years ago, but has four lovely children.  Now she lives alone with her oldest son, Paul, in a home of her own located in a town in the central Peruvian jungle.  Ana, with great courage, is a farmer and works 2 hectares of farmland that she inherited from her mother.  She raises a variety of citrus, including oranges, tangerines, tangelos (citrus) and also coffee.  She sells these products in the La Merced market and hires field hands to help her.  She has also been working as an administrative assistant at a state school for the past 12 years, where she receives a monthly salary.  What she likes the most about her work is that it keeps her busy and she likes being on her own very much.

She says, “The work is tiring and requires commitment, but I always know how to raise my crops with seed, care, and fertilizer.”

Ana is asking for support because she need to buy bags of fertilizer for her coffee and citrus crops.  She is a member of the “Los Milagros” communal bank and this will he her tenth through MFP, where she appreciates all the support that everyone had given her all these years.

Ana will begin maintaining her coffee plantation on her farmland and she will buy sacks of compost to spread on her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is married and has six children. Alma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Alma is a farmer and cares for pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan amount of PHP 14,900 to invest in the piggery business.
 
Alma has been a member of PMPC for one year. She hopes to improve her living conditions in the future, by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to invest in her business of raising pigs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is aged 33 years, and a farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya. She lives with her husband and one child, who is schooling. Jane has been in farming for the past twenty years, producing coffee, cabbages, fruits and bananas, which she sells at the local market in her area. She has a motor bike for a transportation business, as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry birds. By selling the products of the birds she will earn extra income that will help her educate her child and uplift her living standard. Jane aspires to have bought two additional acres of land on which to grow horticultural crops, in the next five years.

Poor climatic conditions and insecurity are her major challenges in farming. Jane thanks Juhudi Kilimo for helping her change the way she does her agricultural business

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Aryemo Otti

texts.en:
Aryemo says that she has benefited a lot from the previous loan, as follows: she increasd her business capital as well as getting more profits, and has started a small construction for her family.

Now she is taking a new loan, to purchase more goods like soda, water, and many others, to resell in her store. Aryemo says that she is happy for the loan.

loans.use: to buy soda, water, soap, and other products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, a 24-year-old father of one child, grows maize, beans and cassava, and earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He also has cows and chickens.

Martin looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Martin will save to buy more land. He dreams of owning a very large, highly-productive farm.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Dulamsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Dulamsuren, 32 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, where she works as a human resource manager and legal advisor in a private business. Her husband is a master machinist in a depot.

They live in a ninth-floor apartment that has some serious deficiencies. Rain and melting snow constantly flow through their roof, forcing them to endure aquarium-like living conditions. Dulamsuren is therefore requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to repair the roof and buy some materials to fix and insulate the walls. By doing so, their home will be a comfortable place to live.

loans.use: to repair her home's roof and walls.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 43 años, convive con Carlos hace 20 años. Ambos tuvieron 2 hijos: Leydi y Yamely, a los que cuidan y crían en su casa propia ubicada en una ciudad de la selva central peruana. Ana no se cansa fácilmente, se dedica a la preparación de alimentos y venta de comida a los profesores y estudiantes de su zona. Una de las ventajas que tiene es la ubicación de su negocio en un lugar estratégico (frente al colegio). Así también prepara picarones (plato típico), en la feria que se realiza los días domingos en su ciudad, obteniendo una ganancia neta de S/. 100 nuevos soles por el día. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ayudar en los gastos familiares.
Ana tuvo que afrontar muchos problemas. Uno de ellos la falta de capital. Con el tiempo y la ayuda de su banco comunal, logró solucionar esos inconvenientes. Ahora requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más mercadería (abarrotes y productos perecibles), con los que preparará los alimentos que expenderá. Éste es su crédito número 11 con MFP. Se siente contenta de tener el apoyo de la entidad. Agradece el trabajo de su banco comunal “Los Milagros”, cuyos socios son responsables.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, verduras, carnes y otros, para preparar los alimentos que expenderá.
texts.en:
Ana is 43 years old and has lived with Carlos for 20 years.  They have two children, Leydi and Yamely, whom they care for in her home, located in the central Peruvian jungle.  Ana does not tire easily and makes food to sell to the professors and students in her zone.  One of the advantages she has is the location of her business.  It’s in a strategic location (across from the school).  She also prepares picarones (a typical dish) at the fair in town on Sundays.  She earns 100 PEN per day.  What she likes most about her work is that she can help with the household expenses.

Ana had to face many problems.  One of them is the lack of capital.  In time and with help from the communal bank, she was able to solve those issues.  Now she needs your support so that she can acquire more supplies (groceries and perishables), which she will use to prepare her food.  This will be her 11th loan through MFP.  She is happy for having this kind of support.  She is grateful for the work of her bank, “Los Milagros,” whose members are very responsible.

She will invest the 2,000 PEN in primary needs products, such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables, meats, and other things with which to prepare the foods she sells.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Chichimuc Group

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Rosalinda esta casada, tiene 43 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene  5 hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, el tejido de cortes típicos, inició este negocio siendo trabajadora con una vecina y hasta el momento lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es jornalero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un  préstamo que sera utilizado para la compra de hilos de diferentes clases y colores, y así poder producir mas, espera en el futuro tener otro telares y trabajadores. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía y al comercio.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosalinda is married, and she is 43 years old. She completed 4 years of primary school. She has 5 children, of whom 2 are studying. She works as an artisan, weaving traditional skirts. She started this business since she was working with a neighbor. She now has 20 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a day laborer. 

A group has been organized to request a loan, which will be used to buy threads of different classes and colors, so that she can increase her production. She hopes in the future to have additional looms and workers. The other group members dedicate themselves to handicrafts and commerce.

loans.use: to buy threads for weaving.

loans.name: Iaeli

texts.en:
Iaeli is 49 years old, married, and has seven children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Iaeli needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weedkiller spray, and more tiapula. She is a new member of SPBD this year. Iaeli will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, weedkiller, and other things for growing taro, bananas and yams.

loans.name: Soonafai

texts.en:
Soonafai is 57 years old, married, and has five children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Soonafai needs a loan to buy another wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weedkiller spray and more tiapula, as well as to pay her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Soonafai will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, weedkiller spray, etc., and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Taumaloto

texts.en:
Taumaloto is 55 years old, married, and has six children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams, which she sells in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Taumaloto needs a loan to buy a new wheelbarrow, a shovel, a rake, some bush knives, a weedkiller spray, and more tiapula. She is a new member of SPBD this year. Taumaloto will use the profits from her sales to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to pay for farm implements, weedkiller spray, and other things for growing taro, bananas and yams.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru:
Зухро 22 года. Она не замужем и живет в родительском доме. В их семье 7 человек и они все очень дружно живут. В детстве, когда Зухро играла с подружками, она всегда входила в роль дизайнера или парикмахера, повзрослев, она стала настоящей и профессиональным парикмахером. Зухро имеет очень богатую фантазию и делает красивые прически как свадебные, так и деловые, а также разнообразные модные стрижки. Ее мать посоветовала ей, что это ее умение может принести ей большой доход. Зухро решила организовать собственный бизнес, услугой парикмахера и прокат свадебных платьев. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Ее салон будет расположено не далеко от ее дома. От полученного дохода она планирует помочь родителям для улучшения условия проживания, а также покупать для себя не обходимые вещи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони для покупки свадебных платьев, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zuhro is 22 years old.  She is not married and lives in her parents' home.  There are 7 people in their family and they live together very happily.  As a child when Zuhro played with friends, she always pretended to be a designer or a hairdresser, having grown up she became a real and professional hairdresser.  Zuhro has a rich imagination and creates beautiful hairdos for weddings and also everyday and different fashionable haircuts.  Her mother advised her that her skill could bring her a large income.   Zuhro decided to start a business - provide hairdressing services and rent wedding dresses.  

With this goal she took a course "Get Ahead" organized by the National Association of Business Women of Tajikistan and earned a certificate.  Now she can start her own business and become successful in this sphere.  Her salon will be located near her home.  She plans to use her income to help her parents improve their living conditions and also purchase necessary things for herself.  She is asking for a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase wedding dresses in order to start her new business.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for her new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment

loans.name: Masituula

texts.en:
Masituula is 24 years old. She is married and has three children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize, beans, coffee, cassava and bananas. They also keep chickens and goats. 

Masituula looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Masituula will invest in her farming business. She dreams of seeing her children receive a university education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Janjay

texts.en: Janjay is 33 years old and lives in Ground Bassa County, an area noted for its fishing industry. She is married and stopped her education at grade 4. She has three children between the ages of 6 and 16 that live with her at home and attend school. For the past two years, she has been selling blouses, slippers and underclothes in the local market. She enjoys her business because she has lot of customers and gets more profits that enable her buy food for her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses, slippers and underclothes for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses, slippers and underclothes for her business,

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Susan sells copra (the dried meat, or kernel, of the coconut) to earn a living and has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy coconuts and then make copra to sell.

Susan hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and then make copra to sell

loans.name: Maxensia

texts.en:
Maxensia is 48 years old. She is married and has six children. She and her husband earn their income through farming. They grow maize, beans and coffee. They also keep cows and pigs. 

Maxensia looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

Maxensia is very glad that she has been offered this chance to serve her community. She dreams of increasing her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married with two children. She is 30 years old and lives in Banglay, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Judith sells snacks to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php. 6,000  to finance her snack-vending business.

Judith hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to finance a snack-vending business

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
Feliza is married with 10 children. She is 60 years old and lives in Tugas, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental.

Feliza sells groceries to earn a living and has had this business for this year. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to finance her grocery store business.

Feliza has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits from the business.

loans.use: to finance her grocery store business.

loans.name: Lasto

texts.en:
Lasto is 31 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize and beans. They also keep goats.

Lasto looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Lasto will save to buy more land. He dreams of being able to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Comelio Simon

texts.en: Comelio, a serious business woman, benefited a lot from the previous loan as follows: She has increased her business stock, paid part of her children's school fees; and now is taking another loan to purchase ground nuts, soda, water, and many other items. She really appreciates the loans.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, soda, water, etc

loans.name: Medi

texts.en:
Medi is 44 years old. He is married and has six children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow bananas, maize, beans and coffee. They also have goats and chickens.

Medi looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Medi will save to buy more land. His biggest dream in life is to be able to give all of his children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
A kind man by the name of Ikrom lives in a house which is in bad condition. His wife is an industrious woman who is a housewife. They have four clever children of ages 25, 23, 20 and 15. 

Ikrom’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but his income is not enough for it. He must repair the roof of his house first, and then he must change the doors and windows. When it rains, the roof of his house can’t withstand it, and his family is afraid of cold and wind. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to repair his house. 

In this way, he will be able to offer his family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month he will make his payment on time. He awaits your support and mercy. Please help him and his family if possible.

loans.use: to buy building materials for repairing his house.

loans.name: Blelin Otoo

texts.en: Blelin says that she benefited from the first loan in many ways. She increased her business capital, she bought a new fridge, and paid her children's school fees. Now she is requesting a new loan to purchase more items such as bananas, water and more.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts, water, soda, and bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes selling business.

loans.name: Eni

texts.es:
Eni de 50 años convive con Daniel, con quién tiene 2 hijos: Paúl y Katia, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia en la selva central peruana.
A Eni le gustan los retos. Su principal actividad es la agricultura. Desde niña contaba con la habilidad de atender los cultivos con esmero. Ahora sus padres le otorgaron casi una hectárea y media de terrenos donde cultiva exclusivamente café.
“Invierto la mayor parte de mi capital en la compra de fertilizantes y e el pago de personal, pero valer la pena, ya que cada año cosecho buenos granos”, menciona. Ya sabe a quién ofrecer sus productos; éstos años no experiencia no fueron en vano. Con la ayuda de su pareja y otras personas que contrata logra mantener sus cultivos en buen estado.
La principal dificultad que tiene son los gastos de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, a los que tiene que mandar pensiones mensuales, pues estudian en otras ciudades. Eni desea adquirir bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos para sus cultivos de café, ya que necesita verlos crecer sanos para el mes de cosechas (mayo a julio). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Milagros”, y este es el crédito número 9 que tiene con MFP, donde agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron en todo estos años.
Eni, invertirá los 2500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico. Cada uno le costará de 100 a 120 soles.
texts.en:
Eni is 50 years old and lives together with Daniel, with whom she has 2 children: Paúl and Katia. She takes care of and educates both children in her own home in the central Peruvian jungle. Her main business is farming. Since she was a child she counted on her ability to take care of the crops with care. Now her parents granted her almost an hectare and a half of land where coffee is farmed exclusively.

"I invested the major part of my capital in the purchase of fertilizers and in the payment of personnel, but it was worth it, since each year I harvest good grains," she mentions. She already knows to whom to offer her products. These years no experience was in vain. With the help of her partner and other people who she hires she succeeds in maintaining her crops in good condition.

The main difficulty that she has are the expenses for the university education of her children, to whom she has to send monthly pensions, since they study in other cities. Eni wants to acquire bags of organic fertilizer for her coffee crops, since she needs to see them grow healthily for the harvest months (May to July). She belongs to the communal bank "Los Milagros," and this is loan number 9 that she has with MFP. She is very grateful for all of the support that they offered her during all these years.

Eni will invest the 2,500 soles in the purchase of bags of organic manure. Each one will cost her from 100 to 120 soles.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As Linda is underage, her mother, Carmen, is taking out this Kiva loan to grow their business. 

Linda is only 16 years old, but her life is already extraordinary. Originally from Colombia, Linda spent seven years in foster care before she joined her new family in the United States three years ago. Her adoptive mom, Carmen, already had seven children of her own before she decided to welcome Linda and her two sisters to the family. 

As if adjusting to a new country, culture and family is not stressful enough to a teenager, Linda was diagnosed with a life threatening disease in 2011. She went through various treatments and lost her beautiful long hair.

Because she had to endure many long days in the hospital, her mother brought her jewelry-making materials to keep her busy. Linda always had a deep love for jewelry. She discovered her passion and talent during her stay in the hospital, resulting in the production of beautiful earrings, necklaces and bracelets. Her first sale took place from the hospital bed, when one of the nurses purchased earrings from her for his mother. From that point, Linda has grown her business without even noticing that she had started one. More nurses and doctors came by her bedside to purchase her designs and the word spread among family and friends.

In August 2012, the Make-A-Wish Foundation granted Linda’s wish to meet and be mentored by her role model, Ivanka Trump, jewelry designer, model and business woman. Read about it here: http://bit.ly/TQewDv. 

Their $6,000 loan will be used for marketing and to buy supplies and packaging material. 

Linda’s jewelry can be purchased from her website: www.LindaDesigns4U.com

video.title: Kiva Borrower Carmen from United States

loans.use: to pay for marketing and supplies for her daughter's jewelry business

loans.name: Uuriinbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Uuriinbayar, 33 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The couple lives in their old house. She has been working as a voice producer in a private television enterprise for five years, and her husband renders taxi service. 

As winter comes to Mongolia, the old wooden house of theirs seems like it can’t withstand the harsh climate. Window glasses are all frozen, and constant wind blowing makes the house very drafty and uncomfortable. In addition, the floor becomes all shattered and the house is completely cold in every corner. So she is requesting a loan amount of 2,000,000 MNT, to buy insulating materials and vacuum-insulated windows. Once their house is insulated, she and her husband can work enthusiastically.

loans.use: to buy insulating materials and vacuum-insulated windows for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase material such as ribbons, silky cloth, tissue paper, and paints in different colors.

loans.name: Haya

texts.en: Haya is a 31-year-old housewife. Her husband has two jobs, one as a public sector employee, the other at a small accessories shop that he owns. While looking after her two sons, she started a small clothing sales business at home where she buys her goods at a wholesale price and sells at a higher price to friends, neighbors, and relatives. She has now applied for this loan to increase the quantity of merchandise she has and bring in a new winter collection.

loans.use: to bring in a new winter collection.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio con 47 años de edad, originario de Granada, casado, padre de 4 hijos todos son independiente, de oficio comerciante. Inicio trabajando como ayudante de otras personas, dinero que le pagaban por el trabajo,  lo ahorraba y luego para ayudarse un poco mas decidió pedir un préstamo para poder establecer su propio negocio, fue allí en que  decidió poner su propio taller de zapatos. El cuenta   con el apoyo de su esposa y el de  sus  hijos.
Julio solicita el préstamo para comprar mas insumo como cuero, suela, pegamento y clavo para  la elaboración de sus zapatos. Ya que sus objetivos es incrementar sus ventas al tener más variedad de zapato sobre todo porque se acerca la época navideña donde  las ventas son muy buenas para el sector comercio. Espera mejorar sus ingresos  y  surtir el negocio con nueva mercadería y variada de productos. Su anhelo es lograr una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio, 47, is a native of Granada.  He's married and the father of four independent children, and he works as a merchant.  He started working as the helper of other people.  He saved the money they paid him for his work and later, to help himself a little, he decided to request a loan to set up his own business.  That was when he decided to start his own cobbler shop.  He has the help of his wife and his children.

Julio's requesting the loan to buy more supplies such as leather, soles, glue, and nails to make his shoes.  His objectives are to increase his sales with a greater variety of shoes, especially because the Christmas season is approaching and sales are very good in the business sector.

He hopes to improve his income and stock his business with new merchandise and a variety of products.  His desire is to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more leather, soles, glue, and nails

loans.name: Omar Hilarion

texts.es: El Sr. Omar tiene 24 años, soltero,  el se dedica a la venta de comida el vende pollos a la broasther en su puesto de venta que se encuentra su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de San Antonio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Omar va a usar este préstamo para la compra de de insumos como pollo, aceite y papa por mayor  para la elaboración de su platillo  y  de esta manera brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr. Omar va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, El Sr. Omar es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y continuar sus estudios ya que el quiere entrar a la universidad.
texts.en:
Omar, 24, is single.  He makes a living selling food, roasted chicken, in his sales stall in his own home, located in the San Antonio area.  This loan is his first sequence with the institution.

Omar's going to use this loan to buy wholesale ingredients such as chicken, oil, and potatoes to make his dish and give his customers good service.  He's requesting the loan to continue improving in his business.  Omar's going to use the profits to continue buying supplies and improving his income.

Omar's a very hardworking person.  He's happy about this opportunity because it's the only activity that allows him to support himself and continue his studies, because he wants to go to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for roasted chicken

loans.name: Las Brisas De Chuiquel Group

texts.es:
La señora esta casada, tiene 29 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se dedica a la elaboración de blusas con bordados, inicio este trabajo por necesidad y aprendiendo con su señora madre y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la sastrería, la elaboración de camisas.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que sera utilizado para la compra de telas de varios colores y diseños, como también hilos que van a ser utilizados para la producción de mas blusas bordadas, espera en el futuro tener un buen negocio y con trabajadores. Las demás integrantes se dedican la artesanía.
texts.en:
This lady is 29 years old and did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She makes embroidered blouses and started doing this out of necessity.  She learned this from her mother and has been doing it for ten years.  She has her husband’s support, who works as a tailor and makes shirts.
She is in the group so that she could request a loan, which she will use to buy various colors and designs of fabric and thread that she will use to make more blouses.  She expects to have a good business with employees in the future.  The other members are also artists.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from the Khelvachauri district of West Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, 2 children and a daughter-in-law and granddaughter. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, the family owns a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown. 

Ali and his family do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are then sold at the local open market. Ali is a very hard-working man with a lot of experience in this work. Ali has requested a loan to purchase building materials to build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, they will be able to sow green seeds and sell harvested greens locally in an open market. This investment will increase his family's income. With the increased income they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse.

loans.name: Anek Tom

texts.en:
Anek, being a 37-year-old businesswoman, benefited from the previous loan as follows: She has increased her capital; has got enough profit and paid part of her children's school fees. 

She is now taking another loan to purchase more soda, water and many other items. She says that she is happy for the loan.

loans.use: to buy soda, water, soap, etc.

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en:
Fathi is 58 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has a family of eight members. He has owned a grocery store since 2010.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a display refrigerator, soft drinks, and some furniture and a table.

He hopes that this loan will help him bring more goods and thus improve his income, which will help him to provide his children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator, soft drinks, and some furniture.

loans.name: Nadera

texts.en: Nadera is a 34-year-old housewife who looks after her two sons while her husband is at his car seating repair business. Nadera makes table covers, tissue boxes and other crafts using sackcloth. She also embroiders fabric sometimes. Now Nadera want to turn her hobby into a small home business. She applied for this loan to bring in more raw material to make larger quantities of what she does now to be able to sell it and be able to participate in any local crafts exhibitions.

loans.use: to bring in more raw materials.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada, 32 years old and widowed, was left to raise three daughters. To be able to do so, she started with her cheerful personality working as a farmer in daytime and in the evenings going back home and selling blankets. But now Ghada decided to concentrate more on her home business and add clothing sales, too, so she can make more time for her daughters. For that reason, she applied for this loan to bring in more clothes and increase her profits.

loans.use: to bring in more clothes

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
Ms Kishwer is a 22-year-old lady. To earn a living, she has been doing stitching and sewing work for the last month. She decided to start her business so that she could contribute to her family's income. She sews for people living near her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of capital, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.

She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed 20,000 PKR from Kashf. She intends to use the requested loan amount to buy additional raw materials such as spools of threads, laces, and zippers in different colors. As a result of the loan proceeds, she hopes to increase her revenues so that she is better be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to satisfy demand by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., spools of thread, laces, and zippers).

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour, a 34-year-old, married woman, has a nine-year-old son. Her husband is a bus driver while she works at home selling clothes, home products, and blankets. What she sells varies based on the season and the market demands. Nour applied for this loan to increase the quantity of winter clothes to sell to increase her profits.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 27 years old. She has one child. She earns her income through farming. She grows maize and also keeps chickens and pigs. 

Peninah looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that she will earn as a CKW, Peninah will save to buy more chickens. She dreams of having a large, very successful poultry business.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Tzamcotom Group

texts.es:
La señora Catarina esta casada, tiene 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, no tienen hijos, se dedica a la producción y venta de muebles de madera, inicio este trabajo junto con su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y realizan el mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de madera, ya que quieren producir mas y mejorar sus ingresos, espera en el  futuro tener mas y trabajadores y de esa forma diferenciarlos con su producto. Las demás integrantes se dedica al la producción y venta de muebles de madera.
texts.en:
Catarina, 52 years old, is married. She did not have the opportunity to study. She and her husband do not have children. She makes and sells wooden furniture. She set up this business with her husband, and now has 8 years of experience. She has the support of her husband and they both carry out the same work. 

She set up a group to apply for a loan which she will use to buy wood, as they want to produce more furniture and increase their earnings. In the future she hopes to have more workers and so differentiate their product. The other members make and sell wooden furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 62 años es viuda. Tiene 7 hijos, pero ya no vive con ellos. Ella tiene una casa propia y vive al lado de una de sus nietas. Rosa es una mujer carismática y trabajadora. Hace más de 15 años se dedica a la preparación de alimentos en un puesto de ventas en un lugar estratégico, ya que en su zona hay un colegio, una universidad y un instituto. “Vendo desayunos, almuerzo, al día como 35 porciones y cada una a 4 soles, si es rentable”, menciona.
Además ofrece dulces y bebidas gasificadas. 
Todo su esfuerzo lo realiza por su nieta y por uno de sus hijos, quién se encuentra en una ciudad lejana estudiando. Una de sus dificultades era adquirir mercadería para abastecer a más clientes, pero con ayuda de MFP, ya estaba más segura. Ahora, por fiestas navideñas el lugar estará más concurrido de perdonas y visitantes, por eso requiere de otro apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 10 con MFP. Se siente muy agradecida por tantos años de confianza. Manifiesta que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Invertirá los 2000 soles en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, carnes, verduras y otros, para preparar los alimentos que expende.
texts.en:
Rosa is 62 years old.  She’s a widow and has seven children, but none live with her anymore.  She has a home of her own and lives with one of her granddaughters.  Rosa is a very hardworking and charismatic woman and has been making food at a food stall for more than 15 years.  The stall is in a good location because it’s in an area where a school, a university, and an institution are located.  “I sell breakfasts and lunches.  Each day I sell about 35 portions, each at 4 PEN.  Yes’ it’s profitable,” she says.

She also sells candies and carbonated soft drinks.

All of her effort is for her niece and for her children who are studying in a faraway town.  One of her main challenges has been to acquire merchandise to supply more customers, but she feels more comfortable with MFP’s help.  Now this area will be more visited during the Christmas season, so she needs more help.  This will be her 10th loan through MFP and she feels grateful for so many years of trust.  She says that she will be on time with her monthly payments.

She will invest the 2,000 PEN in ingredients such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, meat, vegetables, and other things to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is 34 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, beans and coffee. They also have cows and pigs. 

Pascal looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional money that he will earn as a CKW, Pascal will invest in his farm. His biggest dream is to be able to purchase more land. He looks forward to helping those in his community to transform their lives and to lift themselves out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 24 years old. He is married and has one child.

He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. Specifically, they grow coffee, cassava and mangos; they also have goats, chickens and pigs.

Patrick looks forward to becoming a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). As a CKW he will be able to use materials from his "business-in-a-box" (a smartphone, solar charging set and scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes. With the additional money that he expects to earn as a CKW, Patrick would like to buy agricultural supplies. His biggest dream in life is for his family to be happy.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is 45 years old. She lives in the Abasha district of West Georgia with her husband, two children, daughter-in-law and a mother-in-law, who is provided with a retirement pension.

On several occasions Manana has requested a loan from local financial institutions for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were always rejected because of her low income and her lack of experience in the business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. Manana has a plot of land where she grows maize. She does all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good, quality harvest. The crops she harvests are sold locally. She also has a pig and a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products.

Manana is now requesting a loan for her agricultural business. The loan program provides businesses with start-up funding to assist the country's rural poor, who do not have access to most credit products as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan proceeds, Manana would like to purchase a tractor. Her husband and elder son would like to use the tractor to perform agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly on tilling and sowing seasons, and will be paid by landlords. They will save any profits generated as a result of the tractor and will continue to cultivate their own land. She expects that the loan will significantly increase her family's income and will enable Manana to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to increase her family's income by purchasing a tractor

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to cultivate more maize and sorghum than in years past by purchasing additional seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Sameeha

texts.en: Sameeha is a 53-year-old woman who has a clothing sales business. Lately, she put her business on hold for personal reasons and now she is back in business. Sameeha applied for this loan to support her work and increase her winter clothing collection for resale.

loans.use: to increase her winter clothing collection for resale.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina de 53 años es una madre muy abnegada, enviudo hace ya varios años y desde entonces se esfuerza por darles una buena educación a sus 3 hijos. Es propietaria de una vivienda construida a base de madera. Se dedicó por muchos años a la venta de comida por tener una buena sazón culinaria pero al ser un trabajo muy sacrificado por el mismo paso de los años optó desde hace 4 años aperturar un establecimiento consistente en la venta de abarrotes y verduras. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de su distrito gracias a un plan de expansión que su municipalidad le brindó a ella y otros comerciantes de la zona.
Labora desde muy temprano recibiendo el constante apoyo de sus hijos cuando es necesario ausentarse ya que la permanencia en  el negocio hace que la venta de verduras frescas y cereales en su mayoría cumplan las expectativas logrando obtener buenas ganancias en beneficio de la economía familiar.
Al tratarse de un negocio en donde es necesario tener los productos siempre en stock desea contar con capital para la compra de verduras, cereales y demás abarrotes.
Uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo es realizar la compra de un terreno de cultivo el cual planea arrendarlo y cuyas ganancias destinarlo para la  educación de sus hijos quienes dentro de unos años iniciaran a desempeñarse como estudiantes de educación superior. Este es su cuarto crédito, ha logrado mostrar una buena imagen a través del cumplimiento puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Siempre llega puntual en las reuniones de grupo y destaca el buen trabajo que desarrollan los integrantes de su junta directiva.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles seguirá surtiendo su negocio con la compra de cereales, verduras y abarrotes al por mayor.
texts.en:
Catalina is 53 years old and is a very dedicated mother.  She became a widow several years ago and since then she has been working to give her three children a good education.  She has a wood framed house and sold food for many years because she had a good culinary touch, but it was a tough job so four years ago she decided to open a store where she could sell groceries and vegetables.  Her business is located in the district market, thanks to a municipal expansion plan which provided space for her and other merchants in the zone.

She works from early morning, getting constant support from her children whenever she needs to be absent.  The sale of fresh vegetables and cereal grains in bulk provide a good income that benefits the family finances.

She would like to have the capital she needs to buy vegetables, grains, and other groceries so that she will always have these items in stock.

One of her main long term objectives is to buy some farmland where she plans to work and use that income toward her children’s education.  They will begin higher education in a few years.  This will be her fourth loan and has demonstrated to have a good record of payment.  She is always on time with her payments at the group meeting and praises the good work that the board members do. 

She will use the 2,000 PEN to continue stocking her business with grains, vegetables, and groceries.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on clothing.

loans.name: Loveness Kivule Group

texts.en:
MWAJUMA, who is in her late 40's, is married with four grownup children and four grandchildren who are going to school.  She has been selling sodas for five years now.  She works from 8.00 a.m. to 8.00 p.m. daily, and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees for her grandchildren, to buy a DVD deck and to buy a sofa set, dining table and dressing table.  She has paid back all his loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more stock of sodas, juice, water and to start selling  airtime.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy her own car.

MWAJUMA, will share this loan with her loan group "Lovenes" with 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  sodas, juice, water and to start selling  airtime.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Насибахон поставила себе цель стать известным программистом. С этой целью она поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана. Насибахон студентка 5 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители  Насибахон простые рабочие, ее отец таксист, а мать работает воспитательницей в детском садике и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Насибахон обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After finishing high school, Nasibakhon set herself the goal of becoming a famous programmer. To this end, she entered the Tajikistan University of Technology, where she is currently in her 5th year of studies. She is a very intelligent and hard-working young woman who earns excellent marks and takes active part in all university events. Her parents are simple working people - her father is a taxi driver and her mother works in a kindergarten - and they are not in the position to be able to afford the cost of their daughter's education. Nasibakhon has approached Imon International for a loan so she can pay for her tuition. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru: Бехрузу 20 лет. Он очень умный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Бехруз является студентом 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Экономики по специальности налогового дела. Он учится отлично и активно участвует во всех мероприятиях университета. Родители простые рабочие и их доход не позволяет им оплатить за учебу сына. Бехруз запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Behruz is 20 years old. He is a very intelligent and hard-working young man. He is currently in his 3rd year of studies at the Tajikistan State University of Economics where he specializes in the field of taxation. He earns excellent marks and takes active part in all university events. His parents are simple working people, and their income does not allow them to cover the costs of their son's studies. Behruz is now seeking a loan to pay for his university tuition. He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Naeem

texts.en:
Naeem is 51 years old. He is the father of six sons and two daughters, who are between the ages of 9 and 26 years old.

Naeem does his best to support his children by working at his small cafeteria. At his cafeteria, he makes different types of inexpensive sandwiches for his customers.

Naeem is now hoping to do some maintenance on his shop and to construct a new frontage for the shop. In addition, he would like to purchase more food products for his shop. As a result, he applied for this loan to make such business improvements.

loans.use: to improve and expand his business by performing maintenance, constructing a new frontage for the shop, and purchasing additional food items.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada, a 41-year-old, conservative woman has asked her husband to take her place in the photo. 

To be able to support their three kids, Ghada decided to help her husband by starting a small sales business at home. She started with selling cosmetic products and wants to add clothing sales too. For that reason, she applied for this loan to build a clothing collection and buy more cosmetics that will help her increase her profits and have greater variety in what she sells.

loans.use: to build a clothing collection and buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam, 43 years old, is a divorced woman who works in an orphanage in the day time, and at home in the evenings making embroidered dresses. Maryam is a mother for seven who spend the time between her and her ex-husband. Now Maryam has applied for  this loan to purchase more fabrics and colorful threads to increase her productivity and make larger quantities and different models of dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more fabrics and colorful threads.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 31 años, soltera y con dos grandes motivos de vida que son sus hijos Esmit de 11 años y Angel de 3. Actualmente reside en una vivienda de madera en calidad de alquiler.
Desde hace 10 años se inicio como peladora de pollo en la granja de su hermana que se encuentra instalada en casa de su madre, hicieron así un negocio familiar que poco a poco fue ganando acogida entre sus clientes que son las vendedoras del mercado de su localidad.
Considera su actividad como algo dinámica puesto que deja consigo buenas ganancias por ser un producto de mucha demanda entre la población.
Al hallarse en una temporada en que el consumo de pollo presenta un incremento para la realización de actividades como polladas y otros con motivo de fin de año desea contar con capital sufriente que permita solicitar mas javas de pollo a los acopiadores de la capital, esperando obtener buenas ganancias para el pequeño consorcio familiar.
Personalmente desea a futuro independizarse y formar su propia granja avícola para así mejorar su economía familiar y asegurarles a sus hijos una buena educación superior que tanto anhela, adicional a ello desea también incursionar en la venta de prendas de vestir. Este es su préstamo número 4, se siente confiada por como le ha ido con los anteriores préstamo otorgados ya que considera es una herramienta para trabajar con mucha fluidez. Con respecto a su banco comunal siempre asiste de manera puntual a sus reuniones y es una socia muy solidaria muchos casos que se requiera.
Con los 3,500 nuevos soles complementará junto a su hermana su capital para la compra de más javas de pollo.
texts.en:
Haydee is 31 years old, single, and has two purposes in life; her children, 11 year old Esmit, and 3 year old Angel.  She currently lives in a rented wooden house.

She began working as a chicken plucker on her sister’s farm ten years ago.  The farm is at her mother’s home and they created a family business there.  Little by little she began gaining notoriety from her customers; the merchants in the local market. 

She considers her business activity to be dynamic because is leaves her a good income because her product is in demand.

Finding herself in a time when chicken consumption has increased because of the end of year season, she would like to have sufficient capital to buy more chicks from the suppliers in the capital, expecting a good profit from her family business.

Personally she wants to venture off on her own and start her own chicken farm in order to improve her family finances and ensure that her children receive a good higher education.  She also wants to begin selling clothing.  This will be her fourth loan and she is confident because of the way the previous loans have worked out for her, as she considers them to be tools with which to work fluidly.  She always arrives on time for her meetings of the communal bank and she is very united with the other members.

She will use the 3,500 PEN to supplement her and her sister’s capital to buy more chicks.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Las Gladiolas De Palacantun Group

texts.es:
La señora Josefina Bernabela es madre viuda, tiene 41 años de edad, cursó los 2 años de educacion primaria,  tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, el bordado de blusas típica, inicio siendo trabajadora con una vecina y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que sera utilizado pata la compra de telas, y tener mas materia para la producción de blusas, también va comprar hilos, espera en el futuro poder dejar este trabajo a su hija. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía, también al bordado de blusas.
texts.en:
Josefina Bernabela is a widowed mother.  She is 41 years old and has a second grade education.  She has two children who attend school and she is an artist who embroiders typical blouses.  She began as a worker with a neighbor and now has 10 years’ experience.

She joined a group so that she could request a loan that she will use to buy fabrics and thread to have more supplies on hand to produce blouses.  She wants to leave this business to her daughter in the future.  The rest of the group’s members also make embroidered blouses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a wall in our house and install a protective covering over the walls.

loans.name: Gs Cuscateca Group

texts.es:
La Señora Evelyn tiene 31 años de edad tiene dos hijos que  dependen de ella y vive con su esposo, Su actividad principal es la venta de comida, Ella cuenta con mas de 6 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad generadora de ingresos cuenta con una buena clientela ya que su negocio esta ubicado en la maquiladora de tabacos, la mayoría de sus clientes son empleados de esa empresa.
Doña Evelyn esta solicitando el apoyo para la compra de productos, como ser Compra de papelería, accesorios para bisutería, pollo, jamón, harina, refrescos y la compra de una batidora, con el préstamo que se le brinde le contribuirá a tener una mejor existencia de materias primas para  satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que se aproxima la temporada mejor en ventas lo que le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Evelyn uno de sus sueños es darle una excelente educación a sus hijos, mejorar su calidad de vida y contar con una casa que reúna mejores condiciones.

Las otras dos miembras son Jannicela y Edvan.  Jannicela cuenta con una pulpería tiene mas de 3 años de experiencia en el manejo de su negocio  y Edvan  se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de Hortalizas cuenta con mas 3 años de experiencia.

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Señora Evelyn is 31 years old, she has two dependent children and lives with her husband. Her main business is selling food. She has over six years of experience in this income-generating activity. She has a good customer base because her store is located in a tobacco factory. The majority of her customers are employees of this company.  

Evelyn is requesting help to buy products such as stationary, trinkets, chicken, ham, flour, soft drinks, and a blender. This loan will allow to her to stock more goods, so she can meet her customers needs now that the busiest sales season is approaching. This will mean she can earn more and cover her household expenses and financial commitments. 

One of Evelyn's dreams is to give her children a great education, improve their quality of life, and find a house in better condition. 

The other two members of the group are Jannicela y Edvan.  Jannicela has a local store. She has over three years of experience running her business. Edvan makes a living farming and growing vegetables. He has over three years of experience. 

Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - October 2012

loans.use: To buy stationary, trinkets, chicken, ham, flour, soft drinks, and a blender for her business.

loans.name: Pascuala Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Pascuala es una emprendedora originaria de Masaya quien tiene de estar trabajando con la institución 11 años consecutivos, tiene 61 años de edad , casada, con tres hijos mayores ella y su esposo se mantienen con el negocio que consisten en la comercialización de la venta de frutas, pinol, pinolillo. Ella vende en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 7años y ha tenido su negocio por 16.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cacao, frutas frescas, trigo etc.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a entrepreneur from Masaya who has been working with the institution for 11 years. She is 61 years old, married, and has three adult children. 

She and her husband earn a living from their business selling fruits, pinol (flour made from toasted maize), and pinolillo (a drink made of corn meal and cocoa) at the market in Masaya. They have been selling in the Masaya market for 7 years and have owned their business for 16. She will use the loan to buy corn, cocoa, fresh fruits, and wheat etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, cocoa, fruits, and grains to sell at the market.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 30 years old and is from Gaza. She is married and has 4 children, three of them at school.

Khadija asked Ryada for this start-up loan in order to open her own business and open a beauty salon. Through this loan Khadija will buy furniture, hair dryers, an electricity generator, makeup and cosmetics. She hopes that this loan will help her increase the family income to provide her children with a better life and education. The person who appears in the picture is Khadija's husband since she refused to be photographed due to cultural habits.

Ryada's Startup Loan is exclusively for borrowers who are beginning new enterprises, not for existing projects. To qualify, a borrower must show a clear business plan and realistic potential for success. The borrower must also invest their own money and resources; at least 50 percent of the startup enterprise. Ryada believes strongly in the potential of these borrowers and grants them a three month grace period to help them get their business off the ground.

loans.use: to buy furniture, hair dryers, an electricity generator, makeup and cosmetics.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 35-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

Kalsoom has been in the business of gloves-making for the past eight years. Her husband works for low income on a power loom, so Kalsoom is contentedly in business for the sake of her family. She also sews clothes as a part time job. In this way, she is able to effectively handle her family's needs and requirements. 

Recently, Kalsoom contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 13000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as bundles of cloth for the winter season, to inflate her sales. She desires to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as bundles of cloth for the winter season, to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Hrant

texts.en:
Hrant is 23 years old and was born in one of Vanadzor’s villages. He is a student at Yerevan State Pedagogical University in the sport department. Hrant's parents are jobless and unable to pay for his education. This is Hrant's primary motivation for going into business. For almost a year, Hrant has run a successful business. After he finishes his education, he wants to combine his business activity with his main specialty in sport.

Hrant smokes and sells fish to earn a living. He is taking his first steps in business, and he wants to combine his enterprise with studying. Hrant processes fish in the cellar of his own house in Stepanavan City. He buys fresh fish from Vanadzor’s wholesale markets and sells the finished product in Stepanavan's food shops and markets. He already has a lot of clients in Stepanavan City and some smoked fish demand from Vanadzor City. That's why he decided to increase his smoked fish production.

Hrant asks for 400,000 AMD from Kiva lenders to increase his smoked fish production. He hopes to earn a good profit during the big Christmas holiday sales season.

loans.use: to purchase fish for smoking and selling.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Shida, who is in her late 20s, is married and lives with her husband and her two children, both of whom are in school. For three years, Shida has been earning a living by running a retail shop selling a variety of products. She works from 6 am to 10 pm every day, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shida's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to cover household expenses and purchase needed shop items. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

Shida is requesting a new loan, which she wants to use to buy more shop inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business into different areas.

Shida will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Udzungwa," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 45-year-old business lady who is divorced with four children. For the past ten years, her primary business has been mixed-crop farming, and selling second hand clothes has been her secondary business. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Magdalene is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by a KADET staff member. Magdalene will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and more stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her clothing business and to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en:
Doaa is a 22-year-old woman from Gaza. Since 2009, she has owned a shop for renting wedding gowns and evening dresses.

Doaa asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy dresses and window display dolls. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and thus continue her higher education.

loans.use: to buy dresses and window display dolls for the dresses in her shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past five years, Alice has been working hard to manage her vegetable kiosk, which sells tomatoes, fish, and onions. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, fish, and onions for sale. This will help Alice to generate greater profits and expand her business. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, fish, and onions for sale.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina de 22 años es una madre soltera de mucha responsabilidad, tiene como un gran motivo de vida a su pequeña Ángela de 2 años para quien dedica todo su esfuerzo, por momento habita en una vivienda de adobe en calidad de alquiler.
Al hallarse sin empleo, decidió desde hace 3 años sumergirse en el mundo del negocio, dando todo de si , es así como con ayuda de su entidad financiera logró aperturar un negocio dedicado a la venta de prendas de vestir en un local que viene ocupando en calidad de alquiler.
Optó por este negocio debido a que lo considera mas limpio, tranquilo y ordenado sin contar que posee un buen gusto  en la elección de prendas de vestir para sus clientas, pues también posee una buena variedad en prendas de vestir para bebes debido a tiene mas salida en su venta.
Al aproximarse el fin de año desea contar con una amplia variedad de prendas de vestir para damas y niños así como prendas de temporada para fin de año.
Espera desempeñarse con la misma motivación que la caracteriza para cumplir uno de sus objetivos que es el de aperturar una tienda de ropa muy grande en su localidad y sabe que es posible lograrlo si sigue inyectando gotas de esfuerzo y trabajo constante. Todo con el objetivo de brindarle a su pequeño una vida mejor y darle cosas que ella no tuvo de niña. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará mercadería para su negocio consistente en prendas de vestir para niños y damas para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Karina is 22 years old and a single mother with lots of responsibility.  Her two year old daughter, Angela is her great motivation and she dedicates all her effort for her.  She currently lives in a rented adobe house.

Having found herself unemployed three years ago, she decided to go into business, giving her all, and this is how she helps herself financially.  She sells clothing in a shop that she rents.

She opted for this business because she considers it to be cleaner, calmer, more organized, and because she has good taste in clothing for her customers.  She also has a good variety of clothing for babies.
